result.markdown:
---
title: "Solution to introduction to R"
number-sections: true
---

::: {.cell hash='intro-r_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_70c4f47c6fc8a0f2188352bd06d71b4a'}

```{.r .cell-code}
options(scipen = 999)
```
:::


You have the following three vectors:


::: {.cell hash='intro-r_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_7df27596bcfd8cf2c8858bd8de625bd6'}

```{.r .cell-code}
species <- c(
  "MountainBeaver", "Cow", "GreyWolf", "Goat",
  "GuineaPig", "Diplodocus", "AsianElephant", "Donkey",
  "Horse", "PotarMonkey", "Cat", "Giraffe",
  "Gorilla", "Human", "AfricanElephant", "Triceratops",
  "RhesusMonkey", "Kangaroo", "GoldenHamster", "Mouse",
  "Rabbit", "Sheep", "Jaguar", "Chimpanzee",
  "Rat", "Brachiosaurus", "Mole", "Pig"
)

bodywt_kg <- c(
  1.4, 465, 36.3, 27.7, 1., 11700, 2547, 187.1,
  521, 10, 3.3, 529, 207, 62, 6654, 9400,
  6.8, 35, 0.1, 0.02, 2.5, 55.5, 100, 52.2,
  0.3, 87000, 0.1, 192
)

brainwt_kg <- c(
  0.0081, 0.423, 0.1195, 0.115, 0.0055, 0.05, 
  4.603, 0.419, 0.655, 0.115, 0.0256, 0.68, 
  0.406, 1.32, 5.712, 0.07, 0.179, 0.056,
  0.001, 0.0004, 0.0121, 0.175, 0.157, 0.44,
  0.0019, 0.1545, 0.003, 0.18
)
```
:::


- Check which of the following animals are contained in the `species` vector:

Note: If you use `%in%` to check if elements are contained in a vector, the result vector is of the same length as the vector that is **before** the `%in%`


::: {.cell hash='intro-r_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_fc8113fd2bc003d7ae072305cad3410e'}

```{.r .cell-code}
animals_to_check <- c("Snail", "Goat", "Chimpanzee", "Rat", "Dragon", "Eagle")
# Goes through every element in species and returns TRUE if it appears in animals_to_check
species %in% animals_to_check
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 [1] FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE
[13] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE
[25]  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Goes through every element in animals_to_check and returns TRUE if it appears in species
animals_to_check %in% species
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] FALSE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE FALSE FALSE
```
:::
:::



- Calculate mean and standard deviation of brain weight:


::: {.cell hash='intro-r_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_f26f069dd8ed3df6ffd1541710a30104'}

```{.r .cell-code}
mean(brainwt_kg)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 0.5745214
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
sd(brainwt_kg)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 1.334929
```
:::
:::


- Which species have brain weight larger than the mean brain weight of all species?


::: {.cell hash='intro-r_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_88edfe11dc24cc128445b95b341d9aad'}

```{.r .cell-code}
species[brainwt_kg > mean(brainwt_kg)]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] "AsianElephant"   "Horse"           "Giraffe"         "Human"          
[5] "AfricanElephant"
```
:::
:::


- Calculate the ratio brain weight / body weight in percent and save it in a vector:


::: {.cell hash='intro-r_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_9300b9e025161f6a0a849fb872354ff8'}

```{.r .cell-code}
brain_body_ratio <- brainwt_kg / bodywt_kg * 100
```
:::


##### Which animals have a larger brain to body weight ratio than humans?

Step 1: Look at the brain to body ratio of humans


::: {.cell hash='intro-r_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_f7373e9ec210d8d3317795986be32869'}

```{.r .cell-code}
brain_body_ratio[species == "Human"]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 2.129032
```
:::
:::


Step 2: Compare it with the other animals


::: {.cell hash='intro-r_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_cf3d3266986ab802b6f3569fa39618e9'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# New variable for human brain to body ratio
bbr_human <- brain_body_ratio[species == "Human"]
# Are there animals that have a larger brain to body ratio than humans?
brain_body_ratio > bbr_human
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 [1] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE
[13] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE
[25] FALSE FALSE  TRUE FALSE
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Which are these animals
species[brain_body_ratio > bbr_human]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] "RhesusMonkey" "Mole"        
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# or short
species[brain_body_ratio > brain_body_ratio[species == "Human"]]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] "RhesusMonkey" "Mole"        
```
:::
:::


---

## Extras

- Round the vector to 4 decimal places:


::: {.cell hash='intro-r_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-9_520a11a83dc0a36183f84587e9058aaf'}

```{.r .cell-code}
brain_body_ratio <- round(brain_body_ratio, digits = 4)
```
:::



- Which animal has the smallest brain to body ratio?


::: {.cell hash='intro-r_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-10_df83afac272b4f66c3c06caccbbe12f0'}

```{.r .cell-code}
species[brain_body_ratio == min(brain_body_ratio)]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] "Brachiosaurus"
```
:::
:::


The Brachiosaurus has a really small brain with a weight of just 0.1545 kg at a body weight of 8.7\times 10^{4} kg!

- Add elements to the vector


::: {.cell hash='intro-r_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-11_268ef774d13914521f5c7cc06ce4150b'}

```{.r .cell-code}
species_new <- c("Eagle", "Snail", "Lion")
brainwt_kg_new <- c(0.0004, NA, 0.5)
bodywt_kg_new <- c(18, 0.01, 550)

species <- c(species, species_new)
brainwt_kg <- c(brainwt_kg, brainwt_kg_new)
bodywt_kg <- c(bodywt_kg, bodywt_kg_new)
```
:::


- What is the mean brain weight now?


::: {.cell hash='intro-r_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-12_1416a6dc6eac202fcf0d032b78f68a64'}

```{.r .cell-code}
mean(brainwt_kg)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] NA
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# na.rm = TRUE removes missing values before calculating the mean
mean(brainwt_kg, na.rm = TRUE)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 0.5529
```
:::
:::
